data: A flock of wild geese flying across the sunset far away, remote, fantastic, the only living things visible in a world filling with shadows, lent the last touch of beauty to the vast and lonely moors.
H. De Vere (Henry De Vere) Stacpoole
Stacpoole, H. De Vere (Henry De Vere), 1863-1951
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
